intro: Scorzonera mollis subsp. szowitzii, commonly known as the Szóczó's scorzonera, is a perennial herb native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow to orange flowers. The plant produces a tuberous root that is often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in rocky and arid environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and pharmacological studies.
